details.text: Use agile methodology to ensure quick adjustments and provide a better end product
Create wireframes and mockups to share ideas before starting development to get a clear picture and reduce reworking in the middle of a ticket
Take the end-user's experience into account for each decision to ensure the highest quality results that maximize the user's satisfaction
Colors should be WCAG compliant (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines), both AA (minimum contrast) and AAA (enhanced contrast) to optimize accessibility
Fetch data from a REST API to keep the front and back-end concerns from overlapping
Keep one-off code to a minimum, while focusing on creating reusable components that can be leveraged across the application
Use HTML elements for their intended purpose to benefit from the built-in accessibility features
Ensure high coverage in unit tests so we can be confident in the quality of the code and catch bugs early
Use spikes to help identify the requirements of a task so there are less unknowns when the work actually starts
Write each line of code with purpose so that there are no unnecessary blocks that make maintaining the codebase harder over time
Share discoveries with the rest of the team so everybody can learn new concepts together and grow into a more effective unit
Set up a component library (such as Storybook) so other developers can see existing components to use or modify instead of writing new ones
Write self-documenting code and comments to make it easy for other developers to touch your code in the future, and create a documentation page for more complex code
Source control software (Git) with a central repository such as Github, Stash, Bitbucket, etc. for code management
Expert with ES6+ JavaScript and TypeScript syntax
SPAs using JavaScript frameworks such as React and Angular to reduce loading times and ease the stress on company servers
Webpack configs to add and manage SPA features
Skilled with using NPM to pull in, update, or remove packages
Leverages Docker containers to simulate interconnected systems and API calls
Ticket management using tools such as Jira or Asana to keep track of active and upcoming tasks
Continuous integration using systems such as Jenkins or TravisCI
Unit tests run using Jest or Jasmine to ensure quality and high coverage of code
Remote collaboration using tools such as Slack, Zoom, and email
Uses Storybook as a component library to prevent redundant code, while also making it easier to develop and test different component states
CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap or Bulma to ensure responsive layouts and consistent styles across the application
SCSS syntax to add powerful programmatic approaches to stylesheet development
Experimented with Penpot to create UX/UI Designs to share my visions with the team
All the major operating systems (Windows, Mac, and Linux)
Mednet Solutions, June 2019 - June 2023

Managed the codebase by updating NPM packages, ensured 95% or higher unit test coverage, maintained the Webpack configuration file, participated in code reviews to promote product quality, created a component library using Storybook, and defined strict linting rules
Mentored developers of all levels, including team leaders, in many aspects of the front-end tech stack, standards, and methodologies
Created new React SPAs to refactor and replace outdated sections of a PHP monolith, interacting with the REST APIs to ensure proper encapsulation of the front and back-end standards

Collaborated with the team to determine when client-side or server-side solutions would be best, shared wireframes and mockups to prioritize the end-userâ€™s overall experience and accessibility, and to share discoveries
Cambria, April 2018 - October 2018
Personally took on the creation and maintenance of the front-end for an internal tool to store and manage product patterns and matching machine configurations using Typescript and AngularJS
details.highlight: took on the creation and maintenance of the front-end

details.text: Collected data from REST APIs across the company to create a data visualization dashboard for management to detect potential pain points before issues arose
Concordia University, St. Paul, March 2017 - June 2017
CSC225, Object-Oriented Programming, Prof. Haythem Balti

Developed a manual grading system for over 30 students, which was approved by the professor, to ensure fair credit and feedback for improvement and further reading, as well as where and why points were lost
September 2015 - June 2018
Graduated with a B.S. of Computer Science
Graduated Summa Cum Laude
GPA of 3.78
Group leader in Programming and Problem Solving
Lead programmer in Object-Oriented Programming and in Modern Web Design
August 2012 - May 2015
Transferred to Concordia University, St. Paul
GPA of 3.73
Member of Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society

CROWS.title: Alternatively, stick around and enjoy some of my favorite crow facts!

details.text: They have the largest brain to body ratio of all birds, and the anatomy of their brain is similar to that of humans. This results in intelligence that rivals our own
details.highlight: largest brain to body ratio of all birds

details.text: Crows are one of the most resourceful creatures, able to use or create their own tools such as knives or hooks, even if they've never encountered them before
details.highlight: able to use or create their own tools

details.text: Some types of crow have discovered unique methods to crack nuts. If there's a road nearby, they'll place the nut so a car will run it over, then collect their food after the light turns red. If no cars are nearby, they'll fly just high enough and drop it, letting gravity do the hard work
details.highlight: discovered unique methods to crack nuts

details.text: They have discovered that they can use breadcrumbs for fishing
Crows are better at mimicry than parrots, and use it to lure wolves to a dead animal so it can tear the thick skin to feast, and once the wolf is full, it will pick at the remains
Different communities of crows have unique dialects to tell outsiders from the pack
details.highlight: communities of crows have unique dialects

details.text: They communicate details so well that several generations later, the flock is able to recognize individual humans they never met based purely on what they were told by the older crows
Crows are able to accurately judge a human's character by their expression, and with enough trust they will bond and share their treasures
details.highlight: accurately judge a human's character by their expression

details.text: They hold funerals for their dead
Crows choose a mate for life. Even though they reach sexual maturity after 2 years, they often wait until they find the perfect partner
